intro: Scuticaria novaesiae, commonly known as the Novaesiae scuticaria, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in swampy or marshy habitats. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
